seller_description: Product Description: Dole Packaged Foods, LLC is a world leader in growing, sourcing, distributing, and marketing fruit and healthy snacks. Dole sells a full line of packaged shelf stable fruit, frozen fruit, dried fruit, and juices. The company focuses on four pillars of sustainability in all its operations: water management, carbon footprint, soil conservation, and water reduction. Pineapples are a symbol of hospitality, tropical vacations and fun, so it makes sense Dole would take this yummy goodness and put it in a can. Dole Canned 100  Juice* is refreshing, exotic and a delicious alternative to other juices. Dole Juice is 100  juice that is an excellent source of Vitamin C. Gluten free and in BPA free packaging, it tastes great on its own, or in your favorite smoothie, mocktail, cocktail, or marinade. Store unopened juice in a cool, dry place. If you prefer a chilled juice, keep an unopened can in your refrigerator. Shake well before serving. After opening, store in a glass or plastic container in the refrigerator. *With other ingredients. Product details. Is Discontinued By Manufacturer : No. Product Dimensions : 15 x 10 x 6 inches; 13.1 Pounds. Item model number : 10038900773700. UPC : 038900773700. Manufacturer : Dole Foods. ASIN : B002IGA2FW. Country of Origin : Philippines
review: 20 of the 48 cans were damaged, but not from shipping. The shipping box was undamaged, the cardboard wraps were undamaged. As I unwrapped the cans to put them in the pantry I kept finding random cans with dents. Every single package had undented and dented mixed together. I don't understand how this could have happened at any other place than the factory. it's sad...
expected-output: Seller Image: Shows cans in pristine condition, emphasizing the quality and brand trust of Dole with a focus on 100% pineapple juice and packaging that protects the product. The product description highlights Dole's commitment to high quality, sustainability, and careful packaging. Buyer Image: Displays numerous dented cans, despite the outer packaging remaining undamaged, which suggests the issue occurred before shipping, possibly during production or packing. Buyer Review: The buyer is dissatisfied, noting that about 20 out of the 48 cans were dented. They suspect the cans were already damaged before shipping, given the undamaged shipping box and cardboard wrap. This observation casts doubt on Dole's quality control processes at the factory level. Assessment: The buyer's dissatisfaction is valid and points to a probable issue in the production or packaging process. The dented cans could imply a lapse in Dole's quality control standards, despite their emphasis on quality in the product description. The fault appears to lie with the seller's factory or packaging process rather than the shipping process. Conclusion The discrepancy here is due to the damaged cans found in the buyer's order, which conflicts with the seller’s claims of high-quality standards. This quality control issue should be addressed by the manufacturer to ensure better customer satisfaction. The buyer’s dissatisfaction is based on a genuine issue, likely attributable to the seller's operations rather than external factors." The fault lies with the seller, specifically in their quality control or packaging process. The dented cans received by the buyer, despite the undamaged outer packaging, indicate that the damage likely occurred before shipping. This contradicts the seller’s promise of careful packaging and high-quality standards. Addressing this issue at the production or packaging level could improve customer satisfaction by ensuring that all cans meet the expected condition before leaving the facility. The buyer’s dissatisfaction is valid, as they received products that did not align with the seller’s advertised quality.
label: 0:Here seller is at fault
